transcript.text: it's a very important book that came out
about it that you want to take a look at
it's called the crisis of democracy it's
published by the trilateral commission
trilateral Europe the United States
Japan the three industrial democracies
the concern of the book is that there's
too much democracy be concerned about
the fact that in the 60s in all the
industrial world there were all populist
popular uprisings of one sort or another
of the participants said is we have to
have more moderation and democracy these
people have to go back to where they
belong you know just being observers
passive let the serious people run
things and so on and in particularly
they were concerned about students of
course because there were student
activism all over and what they argued
was that I'm now using their words not
mine that the institutions responsible
for the indoctrination of the young
failed the schools the universities the
churches they were not carrying out
appropriate indoctrination of the young
and something has to be done to reverse
this and there were other proposals for
other bad segments women others and so
on well what do you do with regard to
the institution's responsive of the
indoctrination of the young you have to
eliminate the options that young people
had that enabled them to engage in
activism well one of the those options
were they just had too much freedom so
the 1960s were a kind of an expansive
period as a period of economic growth
you know eighteen-year-old kid could say
I'm gonna take off a couple of years and
become become involved in activism I'll
go back and continue my life you got to
end that and what happened right at that
point was a number of measures were
introduced including what's going on
here including raising tuitions so
right at that point college tuition
started going up pretty sharply and I
can't prove that it was a immediate
consequence but it certainly coincided
and other measures were taken which
restricted which made the colleges and
the schools more you know more like the
Marine Corps
you
